author: jochembrouwer
content: I wanted to point out that there is currently (devnet-5 changes for EIP 7702) a new way to change the codehash from emtpy to non-empty by authorizing an already delegated account to the zero address (this clears the delegation). Is this a security problem? See: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/8969/files#r1855538466

author: frangio_
content: afaict it's not an issue. the main concern was that in the previous version there was no indication that account code could change, it was invisible. now 0xef01 makes it explicit

author: jochembrouwer
content: So previously (devnet-4) account executable/readable code could change, and now (devnet-5) the executable code still can, but the readable code is not changed due to 0xef01? (Trying to ensure I get the perspective on how to look at this right ðŸ™‚ )

author: jochembrouwer
content: Just a thought here but we might likely want to get a bit of info from the UX side as well here, because I could imagine it would also be helpful to be able to determine what address the code is delegated to ðŸ¤” (Which we now cannot know on-chain)
